thread.title: Blue Ivy Was, Hands Down, the Best Part of the 2017 Grammys
thread.title_full: Blue Ivy Was, Hands Down, the Best Part of the 2017 Grammys

title: Blue Ivy Was, Hands Down, the Best Part of the 2017 Grammys
text:
Blue Ivy Was, Hands Down, the Best Part of the 2017 Grammys 37 minutes ago Aside from Beyoncé, you have to admit: Blue Ivy stole the Grammys Share Tumble Combined comments & shares on social media 
Everyone, stop what you're doing. You can go home now because you've been upstaged. We've all been upstaged because Blue Ivy's 2017 Grammys look confirms she was not only the greatest person in attendance, but she knows how to paid tribute to a musical legend like a boss. 
More: 2017 Grammys Performers: Get Ready for Some Totally Unexpected Collaborations 
The musical legend in question was Prince and it would appear that Blue Ivy was directly channeling the icon in her stunningly edgy yet appropriate Grammys outfit. Blue Ivy appeared to be clad head-to-toe in pink jumpsuit realness with black lapels and a fluffy white shirt underneath. She kept the accessories to a minimum and sported a braid. She was dressed for her age, yet was sending a strong, empowered vibe via the pantsuit. oh — BuzzFeed (@BuzzFeed) February 13, 2017 
She was all sass once seated in the Staples Center for the Grammys. She was preciously perched on her dad, Jay-Z's, lap and was accompanied by her grandmother, Tina Knowles. The whole brood had a front row seat to the utter gloriousness that was Beyoncé's 2017 Grammys performance. But let's not lose sight of what's important and that's Blue Ivy. 
More: Now Blue Ivy Carter Is Coming Out With Her Own Line of Stuff 
Channeling Prince, whose music is (I think it's fair to say) beloved by all and who was himself a symbol of freedom and positive artistic expression, is not a bad way to go. At five years old, though, Blue Ivy is simply proclaiming herself to be one of the greats with her bold sartorial choices. You have to hand it to her: She looks amazing. BLUE IVY IS DRESSED AS PRINCE pic.twitter.com/C4uzyHqkSj
